update.description:
It is sometimes useful to change the pose of a visual directly without changing the pose of its parent link and without relying on a joint. In our case, we needed to rotate the blades of a drone without producing any effect on the physics world.

In order to do that, we added three member functions. `Link::VisualId()` is used to retrieve the unique ID of a visual from its name. `Link::VisualPose()` is used to get the pose of a visual from its ID. And, finally, `Link::SetVisualPose()` is used to set the pose of a visual.

With the help of these functions, any server-side plugin can set the pose of a visual in the scene. The choice of the time frame to call them is left to each plugin.
update.title: Set the pose of a visual

pullrequest.title: Set the pose of a visual

content.raw:
I see what you mean, returning zero if the pose is not set sounds good to me.

I was just worried that we might be ignoring the initial visual pose, so I changed the test to a case where the visual pose is explicitly set in the SDF, see this [pull request](https://bitbucket.org/ocrave/gazebo/pull-requests/6/merge-with-default-and-add-explicit-visual/diff).
content.html:
I see what you mean, returning zero if the pose is not set sounds good to me.

I was just worried that we might be ignoring the initial visual pose, so I changed the test to a case where the visual pose is explicitly set in the SDF, see this pull request.

pull_request.title: Set the pose of a visual

pullrequest.title: Set the pose of a visual

content.html:
Actually, that's the reason why I had to change msgs.cc in the original commit to explicitly set the pose of each visual to the default value determined by sdformat (0 0 0 0 0 0). I forgot to tell you about it. Wouldn't it be better to return (0 0 0 0 0 0) in Link::VisualPose() when the pose is not yet defined?

  if (msg.has_pose())
  {
    _pose = msgs::ConvertIgn(msg.pose());
  }
  else
  {
    _pose = ignition::math::Pose3d();
  }

That way, we would not have to change msgs.cc.

content.raw:
It would be nice to create a little test for it. Maybe an integration test which sets the visual pose from physics and then checks that the pose changed on the rendering side.

I've been writing some tests for the undo functionality which are quite similar to what I suggested, so I can help with a test if needed.
content.html:
It would be nice to create a little test for it. Maybe an integration test which sets the visual pose from physics and then checks that the pose changed on the rendering side.

I've been writing some tests for the undo functionality which are quite similar to what I suggested, so I can help with a test if needed.
